required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study on Respiratory Impact of High-frequency Jet Ventilation (JVHF) in Interventional Radiology (RI)
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study on Respiratory Impact of High-frequency Jet Ventilation (JVHF) in Interventional Radiology (RI)

brief_summary.textblock: Jet ventilation is used in interventional radiology to reduce respiratory movement and facilitate tumor destruction. The purpose of this study is to describe the respiratory impact of this technique

detailed_description.textblock: Use imaging and respiratory data to describe the impact of JVHF during tumor thermoablation procedures

primary_outcome.measure: evaluate the respiratory impact after the use of JVHF after thermoablation of a solid abdominal tumour.
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe the number of ventilatory disorders
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Score Radiological Atelectasis Score (RAS) of Richter Larsen - RAS: 0, clear lung field; 1, plate like atelectasis or slight infiltration; 2, partial atelectasis; 3, lobar atelectasis; 4, bilateral lobar atelectasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe the incidence of hypoxemia during JVHF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between oxygen saturation at the end of the procedure and at the beginning of the procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe the incidence of hypercapnia at the time of a JVHF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between end of procedure and beginning of procedure capnia

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe the incidence of barotraumatic pulmonary lesions at the time of a JVHF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of barotraumatic pulmonary lesions on the imaging

study_pop.textblock: This study will be offered to patients benefiting from thermoablation of abdominal tumors under JVHF. Recruitment will take place during the pre-anesthetic consultation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Major patient
- Patient benefiting from an abdominal tumor thermoablation procedures
- Patient who gave consent
- Patient with a social protection scheme
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pulmonary thermoablation procedures
- Thermoablation of abdominal tumors required a transpleural passage
- Patient under guardianship or curatorship
- Patient not understanding French
